messages.message: in human review, what is the expected behavior for displaying/calculating provenance on reextraction? i reclassified a record from original class --> _Other_ --> original class and i'm not seeing the provenance i saw before. assuming this is a bug but wanted to check @andy @jack.robbins @Serena cc: @prateek.tenkale
Will let the others chime in here, but potentially is it cause Other doesn’t have the same field as the original class
Definitely odd the provenance doesn’t repopulate though

hmm i can't seem to open the ibmsg for the re-extraction output rn, sandbox being slow, but it doesn look like the /results call for the re-extraction job doesn't have the provenance info (the one made before /set-records is called), so it could be a refiner step problem or how re-extraction is being called? can send the ibmsg contents once it loads at some point

yeah i don't see any provenance info in refined phrases. there is also no document text, but there is line info, idk what is exactly used to calculate provenance but maybe it's not being passed correctly or maybe the provenance tracking for re-extraction isn't being set?
also prateek and i checked and it's not a ibdoc migration issue, something from before
honestly I can't think of a scenario where we shouldn't show provenance if extraction has run properly - if everything else is working properly, provenance should as well. This seems like a bug
